entry.title: Tropical Chow Hypersurfaces
entry.summary: Given a projective variety X of codimension k+1 in P^n the Chow hypersurface Z_X is the hypersurface of the Grassmannian Gr(k, n) parametrizing projective linear spaces that intersect X. We introduce the tropical Chow hypersurface Trop(Z_X). This object only depends on the tropical variety Trop(X) and we provide an explicit way to obtain Trop(Z_X) from Trop(X). We also give a geometric description of Trop(Z_X). We conjecture that, as in the classical case, Trop(X) can be reconstructed from Trop(Z_X) and prove it for the case when X is a curve in P^3. This suggests that the tropical Chow hypersurface can be used to construct a tropical Chow variety.
